page.title: 08St Peter's Bridge Carnival
page.content: After many years Burton is to have a second river crossing. The old Trent Bridge has been unable to cope with the peak-time traffic for a very long time, so 1985 is an important year for the town. To celebrate the occasion a carnival was held on the bridge before it was actually opened to traffic. There was a procession of over forty floats, and an aeroplane (BAC 111) flew over carrying people who had paid to see the carnival from the air. There were some stalls selling souvenirs and anyone who paid a pound was presented with a certificate to commemorate the occasion. Races were held over the bridge and there were other competitions. It was an interesting and exciting day, spoiled only by the rain which began to pour down half way through the afternoon.
